column3: Illinois which is home to both the first openly-LGBTQ advocacy group in the United States and to Boystown
column4: the first officially recognized gay village in the U.S. Boystown is now known for its nightlife and colorful atmosphere. In Chicago weâ€™ll be working with Project Fierce
column5: an incredible organization that aims to reduce LGBTQ youth homelessness in Chicago by providing accessible housing and support services. At a time when LGBTQ youth are at greater risk for depression
column9: organizations like Project Fierce are a necessary resource for teens that donâ€™t feel safe. About 40% of homeless American teens identify as LGBTQ and Project Fierce can provide them with a safe and comfortable environment. Want a ticket upgrade? Weâ€™re taking donations of basic necessities that are often taken for granted. We are asking that you bring a new stick of deodorant to donate at the show. column1: consivanqueen 152481636298 "2016-10-29 22:11:53 GMT" http://consivanqueen.tumblr.com/post/152481636298/kansas-city-3 "troyesivan: helloooo KC!! Kansas City has a rich history of LGBTQ activism
column2: and reminds us just how important a safe space can be! :~) In the 1980â€™s
column3: with the discovery of AIDS and increased discrimination against the LGBTQ community
column4: some women in the Kansas City area started Phoenix Books. This local gathering space gave the LGBTQ community a safe space to gather
column7: and even make change. The community created at Phoenix Books gave people like Jon Barnett
column8: the founder of a local AIDS-activism group
column9: the encouragement to run of political office as an openly gay man. Though Barnett lost his bid for city council
column11: LGBTQ people existed in Kansas City. This was a huge step in the process for Kansas City to pass an ordinance banning discrimination based on sexual orientation. Tonight
column12: we partner with LIKEME Lighthouse-KC which is a volunteer-based organization that connects the LGBTQ community to resources that they can take advantage of. They also offer on-site counseling services. Because LGBTQ individuals
column14: may not know where to go to get services such as therapy
column17: LIKEME Lighthouse-KC is a valuable resource. Your support of this organization will help local youth get connected to services they may otherwise go without. Want a ticket upgrade? Weâ€™re taking donations that are often taken for granted. We are asking that you bring lightly used prom wear to donate at the show. Bring at least one to be entered in a raffle for a ticket upgrade. See you tonight!! Troye x" False text

column1: consivanqueen 152350570298 "2016-10-26 21:08:55 GMT" http://consivanqueen.tumblr.com/post/152350570298/dallas-3 "troyesivan: Hey Allllllll
column2: Today the tour stops in Dallas
column3: TX. LGBTQ history runs deep in Dallas
column4: and The Dallas Way keeps great record of it. Founded in 2011
column5: the organizationâ€™s mission is to compile the untold stories of local LGBTQ community members. The Dallas Way has partnered with the University of North Texas to create a digital exhibit chronicling the people
column7: and events that were important to the LGBTQ community in this area. On the #SuburbiaTour we are focusing on LGBTQ-inclusive curriculum in schools.  The work that these two organizations are doing is immensely important. If LGBTQ history isnâ€™t made available to the public
column8: it will be like these people never existed. If LGBTQ kids grow up seeing people they identify with making a difference and shaping the world in which they live
column9: they will know that they too
column10: can make an impact in the world. The organization we are working with tonight is The Resource Center. The Resource Centerâ€™s Youth First program is one of the only programs in the area specifically focused on the needs of LGBTQ youth. With approximately 15
column11: 000 LGBTQ youth living in North Texas
column12: these services are vital in helping them with issues they face with their family members
column14: and fellow students. Youth First serves those ages 12-18
column16: and build the confidence they need to lead an authentic life. Want a ticket upgrade? Weâ€™re taking donations of basic necessities that are often taken for granted. We are asking that you bring a new stick of deodorant to donate at the show. Bring at least one to be entered in a raffle for a ticket upgrade. Thanks yaâ€™ll and see u tonight!!! Troye x" False text

column2: Texas. Houstonâ€™s LGBTQ community took off in the â€˜60s centering around the gay neighborhood of Montrose
column3: which grew to include popular bars such as Montrose Mining Company in â€˜78. Starting in 1995
column4: the Houston Splash event has attracted thousands as it celebrates the black and latino LGBTQ communities. With the election of Annise Parker in 2010
column5: Houston became one of the first major cities in the U.S. to elect an openly gay mayor.Iâ€™m so so so looking forward to seeing everyone dancing here tonight!!!Troye xWant a ticket upgrade? Weâ€™re taking donations directly to the Ally Coalition to enter into a raffle for a ticket upgrade. Tickets will be $3 or 2 for $5." False text

column1: consivanqueen 152224906973 "2016-10-24 00:16:11 GMT" http://consivanqueen.tumblr.com/post/152224906973/austin "troyesivan: Hiii guys
column2: Today is October 23rd weâ€™re performing in Austin
column4: Austin held the first pride parade in Texas
column5: kicking off the cityâ€™s vibrant LGBTQ community. In 1987
column6: Austinâ€™s Glen Maxey became executive director of the Lesbian/Gay Rights Lobby of Texas. His 1991 election to the Texas House of Representatives showed growing acceptance in a state that still criminalized same-gender relationships. The city has now continued to create a widespread LGBTQ community.For our Austin show our partner is Equality Texas
column7: an organization whose mission is to secure full equality for LGBTQ Texans. Working for just legislation and protection for LGBTQ youth
column8: Equality Texas encourages Texans to take action through education
column10: and collaboration.Equality Texas is super dedicated to protecting Texasâ€™ youth and is constantly working on promoting legislation that prohibits discrimination in schools. They focus on supporting young members of the LGBTQ community within their family
column12: and social lives. Want a ticket upgrade? Weâ€™re taking donations to enter into a raffle for a ticket upgrade. Tickets will be $3 or 2 for $5 :)Canâ€™t wait to see u guys tonight!!!!Troye x" False text

column3: which was started in 1950. Since then
column4: LA has been on the edge of LGBTQ issues - Griffith Park
column6: was the home to the first â€œGay Inâ€
column7: where LGBTQ individuals gathered together in the name of solidarity.For tonightâ€™s show we are partnering with Safe Place for Youth. Since 2010
column8: SPY has grown from a volunteer-only organization to a staff of 13 professionals. SPY serves nearly 1
column9: 000 homeless youth ages 12-25 in Los Angeles
column10: with a disproportionate number of those youth identifying as LGBTQ. SPY offers programs such as drop-in services
column13: and health care to assist their clients in transitioning to a stable life away from the streets. They are super connected with the homeless youth population in West LA
column14: and work hard to provide a positive
column15: trauma-informed environment for them. As well as offering meals and clothing
column16: SPY officially added showers to their facility in July. Amenities like this give the center a home-like feel
column17: allowing young people to feel safe and relaxed while receiving life-saving support. Weâ€™d love for u guys to bring new socks to donate to Safe Place For Youth. Bring at least one to be entered in a raffle for a ticket upgrade <3Love Troye x" False text
